str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From agapao; beloved.
And, even, also, namely.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remind, admonish, be reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall. From ana and mimnesko; to remind; to recollect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
Everywhere, in all places. Genitive case of a presumed derivative of pas; universally.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
